verses.verse: Therefore since we have this ministry, just as we have received mercy, we don't become discouraged,

but have thrown off the hidden things of dishonesty, not walking in deceptive practices, nor corrupting the Word of God deceitfully, but by showing the truth plainly, showing ourselves [to be alongside the truth] to every one's conscience in the sight of God.
If our gospel is hidden, it is hidden to those who are lost,
in whom the god of this world has blinded the minds of those who don't believe, lest the light of the glorious gospel of Christ--who is the image of God--should shine on them.
We don't preach ourselves but Christ Jesus the Lord and ourselves [are] your servants for Jesus' sake.
For God, who commanded light to shine out of darkness, has shinned in our hearts, to [give] the light of the knowledge of God's glory on the face of Jesus Christ.
But we have this treasure in earthen vessels, so that the superiority of this power may be of God not from us.
We go through hard things but are not distressed; we are perplexed but not to the point of despair.
We are persecuted but not forsaken; cast down but not destroyed.
We are always carrying around the death of the Lord Jesus in the body, in order that the life of Jesus might also be easily seen in our body.
For we, who live, are always being handed over to death for Jesus' sake in order that the life of Jesus might be clearly seen in our mortal flesh.
So then death is working in us but life in you.
Having the same spirit of faith just as it is written, "I believed and so I have spoken;" we also believe and so speak,
knowing that he who raised up the Lord Jesus will also raise us up by Jesus and will present us along with you.
For everything is for your sake, in order that abundant grace might greatly increase through thanksgiving to the glory of God.
For this is the reason we don't give up even though our outward man perishes yet the inward is renewed day after day.
Our light weight troubles, which are short lived, accomplish for us exceedingly greater and eternal weight of glory.
For we aren't looking at the things which are seen but the things not seen, for what is seen is temporary but the things not seen are eternal.
